description:
This is a market on a number of times the #1 song will be streamed globally by Spotify on the week ending November 25, 2021. 

The resolution source for this market will be Spotify Charts (https://spotifycharts.com/), which ranks the most popular songs streamed by Spotify, filtered by "Global", "Weekly", and "November 25." Please note that if this resolution source is unavailable at resolution time, the new updated page https://charts.spotify.com/, https://spotifycharts.com/home/, or whichever link points to the updated charts will be used instead.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if at least one song will record 45,000,000 or more global weekly streams, for the week ending on November 25th. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be checked on November 26th, 8:00 PM ET. If the data isn't available by November 30, 8:00 PM ET, the market will resolve 50/50. 

-----------------
Please note, Spotify Charts website is going through redesign. However, the data on a new version (https://charts.spotify.com/) is the same.

Note, the stream count you see in charts might look different to the app and Spotify for Artists.

Spotify generates chart stream numbers using a special formula that protects the integrity of charts, and makes sure all voices of our users are reflected. It means not every stream on Spotify is eligible for Charts. Some songs may have fewer chart-eligible streams than others, depending on streaming behavior.

events.title: Will the top song on Spotify Charts hit 45M global streams for the week ending on November 25?

question: Will the top song on Spotify Charts hit 45M global streams for the week ending on November 25?
